My literal favorite game of all time. I find myself always coming back to replay the whole game. I started on orange box and I think I beat it at least 15 times.

Half-Life series went to a great direction of FPS genre. Valve made a sequel, which considered this game as a Game of the decade. Game is set in a distant future, somewhere in Eastern Europe, about twenty years after the Black Mesa Incident from the first game. 
The main character is a scientist named Gordon Freeman, who's kicking some major *** with his partner Alyx Vance. Freeman, who hasn't aged a day since he disappeared after the Black Mesa Incident because he was in stasis, appears on a train heading to City 17. A couple of citizens talk about city life and the process of being transferred to City 17. Arriving there, Gordon meets armed police officers known as Civil Protection. Gordon is forced to escape City 17, with Civil Protection officers in hot pursuit.

+Game is aged well in the year 2004, it can also be placed near new titles with AAA graphics which we got now.
+Controls feel great, movements are very solid, no mouse skip or autoaim.
+Storywise this game is like a blockbuster filled with action. if we get to the last part of the game, you can really be excited using your super powered weapons. It's not an immersive storytelling like game wants you to believe but you feel like you're into this game yourself and play as you rather than Gordon Freeman.
+Soundtrack is well made, give you that special mood for killing zombies abd combines, same goes for sfx
+First Valve game on this engine, presentation and the beggining of source engine legacy began with this. This game is a father of Team Fortress 2 and Portal francise.

Final Verdict: 9.5 AWESOME (it's totally nine and a half, half of enjoyment counts twice as fun)

This game was simply amazing, I enjoyed endless hours of fun! Good story, and amazing fighting! After playing the first Half Life, this was my number one game to buy. When I completed all the episodes, I was hungry for more! I'm sure you will agree.

The best single-player experience on PC, HANDS DOWN. Even though the graphics are a bit dated, the game is still a marvel in story-telling and gameplay. If the meta-critic score hasn't convinced you to get this game, look at the price. For under $10, this is a bargain.

I also recommend Episode 1 and 2..but if you want an even better deal, go and look at the Orange Box, the best bundle of games released by Valve in gaming history.

A girl with no hands does a better job at giving a handjob than this game does to keep me entertained. I can't even put myself to progress past the first few levels. I'd much rather pass a kidney stone than spend any more grueling minutes attempting to scower through poorly constructed levels, void of any sort of atmosphere. The maps are more akin to a doctor's waiting room rather than a dystopian city. There's a general feeling of disconnect whilst playing this game as well. It's as if each of my keystrokes are reported to a geriatric woman with cataracts and then sent back to the game client via telegram before I see any sort of result on my urine-soaked screen. 

If you enjoy poorly scripted events, traveling through drab maps at a lethargic pace, Airboat Simulator 2004 is the game for you. Otherwise, you're best off spending your $10 on DLC for a game that you don't own, and then hitting yourself in the genitals with a torque wrench until you think of another way to waste your money.

10/10

This series is amazing, I started playing the first one about a year ago when it was on sale and played it for a little while, but when I saw the zombies and Aliens I said oh great another zombie/fps horror game so I put it down and didn't pick it up. Well one day i got really bored and was wondering why everyone liked this game so much so I decided to pick it up again and try it again. It was amazing and am so glad I gave it another chance. The storyline is so mysterious and wonderful, the puzzles can keep you at the game (unless you use a guide of course) for hours wondering what to do. The first game, more than the second is almost like a platforming, puzzle, fps. I find the best way to describe the game as a fps Portal game. I give this game a 10/10 for everything. This game will have you glued to the screen until you beat it then make you upset enough to buy Episode one, so I recommend just buying the whole bundle.

One of the best FPS ever made, what else do I need to say?

Superb game. Unlike most FPS games, HL2 is truly challenging. The combination of a puzzle game and a shooter game meshes together so seamlessly, that it becomes the best of both worlds. A puzzle game is hard, but boring. A shooter game is exciting, but mindlessly easy. HL2 brings the two together to create an intensly challenging, yet adrenaline-pumping shooter that is witty, intelligent, and backed up by a storyline that could be comparable to that of a good movie. Buy it now, while its still on sale!
Classic, played it through more than once. Can't go wrong with good ole HL2.
